intro: Osmites leucantha, commonly known as the white osmite, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and they often have a reddish or purple tinge on the underside. Osmites leucantha is typically found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in cooler, temperate climates.
